As a Software Engineer, I bring a strong foundation in software development and a deep expertise in machine learning to create cutting-edge solutions. My experience spans designing and deploying LLM systems, building robust RAG pipelines, developing scalable web applications, and implementing AI-driven technologies. I am passionate about advancing model behavior to craft intuitive, impactful user experiences and solving complex challenges across diverse business use cases. By blending my software engineering skills with machine learning knowledge, I strive to deliver innovative and scalable solutions that drive meaningful results.


When I'm not diving deep into code, I enjoy traveling, capturing moments through my camera lens, and playing music!

Projects

AI‚Äôm Right

An ETL-based RAG pipeline and multimodal indexing engine designed to empower users to create quizzes, generate handouts, and search topics within videos and PDFs. Built with RAG, Claude, Pinecone, Marengo, Aryn, and Sycamore.
This project was my group submission for SBHacks'2025 Hackathon.

GitHub DevPost

Financial Performance Analysis Using Earnings Call

Designed a system utilizing a LangChain RAG pipeline to predict stock market trends based on CEO public appearances in earnings calls. Achieved a KL-divergence of 4.3, indicating a meaningful difference.

GitHub Medium

Explorations of Regularizations in CNNs

Investigated regularization techniques for CNNs, classifying them into input, internal, and label-based methods. Achieved comparable accuracy (80.9%) to AlexNet using a significantly simpler model (450k parameters vs. 60M).

GitHub Report

Evaluating Exhaustiveness of Synthetic Code Generated by LLMs

Enhanced evaluation techniques for analyzing LLM-generated code, optimizing debugging workflows for Java, Python, C++, and JavaScript. Employed pass@k metrics to evaluate code generated by LLMs, including ChatGPT and Gemini.

Report

ThreatGator - A Threat Intelligence Platform

Developed a robust platform that aggregates data from diverse social media sources, including Twitter, Reddit, and blog posts, processing over 1 million posts weekly. Fine-tuned BERT models for Named Entity Recognition (NER) and Relationship Extraction (RE), enabling advanced threat detection. Set up microservices in Java Spring Boot, integrating Elasticsearch and Kafka for scalable data processing. Leveraged unstructured textual information to generate STIX2 objects for efficient threat information exchange.
